meanings.definition: A mass of nerve tissue containing cell bodies of neurons
meanings.sent1: The ganglia in the brain help control movement and sensation.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study ganglia to understand how the nervous system functions.
meanings.sent3: The ganglia had a meeting to discuss sending signals to the muscles.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts buzzed around her brain like a busy ganglia.
meanings.sent5: The ganglia resembled a bustling city, with messages traveling like cars on a highway.

meanings.definition: A group of nerve cell bodies located outside the central nervous system
meanings.sent1: The ganglia near the spine help regulate bodily functions.
meanings.sent2: Injuries to ganglia can affect the communication between nerves.
meanings.sent3: The ganglia decided to take a vacation from sending signals.
meanings.sent4: His ganglia were like a team of messengers delivering important information.
meanings.sent5: The ganglia acted as a relay station, passing messages along the nerve pathways.

meanings.definition: A cluster of nerve cells in the peripheral nervous system
meanings.sent1: The ganglia in the arms help control movement and sensation.
meanings.sent2: Signals pass through ganglia to reach different parts of the body.
meanings.sent3: The ganglia threw a party to celebrate a successful signal transmission.
meanings.sent4: Her ganglia lit up with excitement as she received good news.
meanings.sent5: The ganglia functioned like a traffic hub, directing nerve impulses to their destinations.
